Claim: Italian president said that Italy has surrendered to the coronavirus.
Explaination: Neither the Italian Prime Minister or President have stated that Italy has surrendered to the virus. We even cross checked with Italian fact checkers.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italian president said that Italy has surrendered to the coronavirus.

Explanation:Neither the Italian Prime Minister or President have stated that Italy has surrendered to the virus. We even cross checked with Italian fact checkers.

https://www.boomlive.in/fast-check/did-italian-president-surrender-to-coronavirus-outbreak-fake-quote-viral-7391

Claim: Coronavirus case in Uttar Pradesh district, India.
Explaination: Authorities denied.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus case in Uttar Pradesh district, India.

Explanation:Authorities denied.

https://factcheck.afp.com/indian-health-authority-refutes-hoax-report-coronavirus-case-uttar-pradesh-district

Claim: Myanmar’s former military junta donated Ks 1000 Lakhs to COVID-19 fund.
Explaination: The list of donors in The Mirror daily circulated on March 26 shows no name of former military junta or current army chief or former president.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Myanmar’s former military junta donated Ks 1000 Lakhs to COVID-19 fund.

Explanation:The list of donors in The Mirror daily circulated on March 26 shows no name of former military junta or current army chief or former president.

https://myanmar.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-post-claiming-myanmar-former-military-junta-donates-covid-19-fund/

Claim: China is seeking court’s approval to kill all who tested positive with coronavirus.
Explaination: The official website of the National Health Commission of the People’s Republic of China uploaded the daily brief on coronavirus and there was no mention of any such case there
Label: False
html:
Claim: China is seeking court’s approval to kill all who tested positive with coronavirus.

Explanation:The official website of the National Health Commission of the People’s Republic of China uploaded the daily brief on coronavirus and there was no mention of any such case there

http://newsmobile.in/articles/2020/02/07/china-seeking-courts-approval-to-kill-the-over-20000-coronavirus-patients-no-this-news-is-fake/

Claim: Fake quote of Senator of the Philippines Francis “Kiko” Pangilinan saying he wants children to be exempted from the lockdown.
Explaination: Pangilinan did not say the quote attributed to him. News5 also said the graphic did not come from any of their official social media accounts.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Fake quote of Senator of the Philippines Francis “Kiko” Pangilinan saying he wants children to be exempted from the lockdown.

Explanation:Pangilinan did not say the quote attributed to him. News5 also said the graphic did not come from any of their official social media accounts.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/255940-pangilinan-says-government-should-exempt-children-total-lockdown

Claim: Tanks are coming into U.S. towns in advance for martial law
Explaination: Tanks were only on the move in one town in California because they were being repaired.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Tanks are coming into U.S. towns in advance for martial law

Explanation:Tanks were only on the move in one town in California because they were being repaired.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Tanks-Are-NOT-Rolling-Into-American-Towns-In-Advance-Of-Martial-Law.html

Claim: Gargling salt with water “eliminates” the 2019 novel coronavirus.
Explaination: Local and international health authorities have said there is not enough study that proves gargling water with salt eliminates the novel coronavirus. To date, there is still no known cure for it.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Gargling salt with water “eliminates” the 2019 novel coronavirus.

Explanation:Local and international health authorities have said there is not enough study that proves gargling water with salt eliminates the novel coronavirus. To date, there is still no known cure for it.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/254504-gargling-salt-water-eliminates-coronavirus

Claim: NYC did implement a citywide quarantine.
Explaination: NY Mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted it was a false alarm.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NYC did implement a citywide quarantine.

Explanation:NY Mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted it was a false alarm.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471910-fact-check-New-York-City-is-NOT-set-to-undergo-citywide-quarantine.html#live

Claim: An image shows Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer criticizing President Trump’s restrictions on foreign nationals traveling to the U.S. from China.
Explaination: It was a fake tweet.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image shows Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer criticizing President Trump’s restrictions on foreign nationals traveling to the U.S. from China.

Explanation:It was a fake tweet.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/social-posts-share-fake-schumer-tweet/

Claim: Helicopters Are Spraying Disinfectants To Try To Eradicate Coronavirus.
Explaination: False information being spread on Facebook. Completely made up, but post is spreading across countries.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Helicopters Are Spraying Disinfectants To Try To Eradicate Coronavirus.

Explanation:False information being spread on Facebook. Completely made up, but post is spreading across countries.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472052-fact-check-helicopters-are-not-spraying-disinfectants-to-try-to-eradicate-coronavirus.html

Claim: “[The coronavirus is] ‘new’ yet it was lab-created and patented in 2015”.
Explaination: The post references the Wuhan coronavirus, but the patent filed is clearly stated to be for the SARS coronavirus, which caused the 2003 outbreak. Neither the SARS nor Wuhan coronavirus is lab-created; evidence points to an animal reservoir as the source of infection.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: “[The coronavirus is] ‘new’ yet it was lab-created and patented in 2015”.

Explanation:The post references the Wuhan coronavirus, but the patent filed is clearly stated to be for the SARS coronavirus, which caused the 2003 outbreak. Neither the SARS nor Wuhan coronavirus is lab-created; evidence points to an animal reservoir as the source of infection.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/contrary-to-claims-in-viral-social-media-posts-wuhan-coronavirus-was-not-lab-created-nor-was-it-patented-years-before-outbreak/

Claim: Saddam Hussein talked about coronavirus to his cabinet and army in the nineties. He said that America has threatened him to spread this virus if he doesn’t follow their command.
Explaination: The viral video is a doctored version of the original video shared by Associated Press in 2015. The audios of both the videos are different not only in terms of their content but voice as well. In the original AP video, Saddam Hussein does not mention the word ‘virus’ or ‘coronavirus.’
Label: False
html:
Claim: Saddam Hussein talked about coronavirus to his cabinet and army in the nineties. He said that America has threatened him to spread this virus if he doesn’t follow their command.

Explanation:The viral video is a doctored version of the original video shared by Associated Press in 2015. The audios of both the videos are different not only in terms of their content but voice as well. In the original AP video, Saddam Hussein does not mention the word ‘virus’ or ‘coronavirus.’

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/doctored-video-of-saddam-hussein-used-to-claim-usa-threatened-iraq-with-cornaivrus-in-1990

Claim: A runny nose and sputum secretion are not symptoms of novel coronavirus.
Explaination: WHO listed those as possible symptoms.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A runny nose and sputum secretion are not symptoms of novel coronavirus.

Explanation:WHO listed those as possible symptoms.

https://factcheck.afp.com/international-health-advisories-contradict-false-claim-runny-nose-not-coronavirus-symptom

Claim: Black skin is resistant to coronavirus.
Explaination: There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory and experts have already denied it.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Black skin is resistant to coronavirus.

Explanation:There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory and experts have already denied it.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-a-pele-negra-e-resistente-ao-coronavirus/

Claim: “(Former U.S. President Barack Obama) set up anti-pandemic programs in 47 vulnerable countries as a way to protect against something like the coronavirus. Do you know that Trump closed 37 of them?”
Explaination: News reports in early 2018 said the CDC was preparing to scale back its anti-pandemic programs in some countries because an early source of funding was running out and the agency didn't expect to receive new money from the Trump administration.The spending bills that lawmakers ultimately passed provided more money for those CDC programs than Trump’s budget requests asked for.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “(Former U.S. President Barack Obama) set up anti-pandemic programs in 47 vulnerable countries as a way to protect against something like the coronavirus. Do you know that Trump closed 37 of them?”

Explanation:News reports in early 2018 said the CDC was preparing to scale back its anti-pandemic programs in some countries because an early source of funding was running out and the agency didn't expect to receive new money from the Trump administration.The spending bills that lawmakers ultimately passed provided more money for those CDC programs than Trump’s budget requests asked for.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/12/joy-behar/view-co-host-wrongly-says-trump-shut-down-37-globa/

Claim: Images shows how Indian police have beaten up migrant workers amid India’s lockdown for commuting
Explaination: All the images are old and unrelated to the ongoing COVID-19 Lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Images shows how Indian police have beaten up migrant workers amid India’s lockdown for commuting

Explanation:All the images are old and unrelated to the ongoing COVID-19 Lockdown.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-old-images-shared-as-migrant-workers-beaten-during-coronavirus-lockdown/

Claim: A video says “the coronavirus was invented and patented in the USA and then planted in China.”
Explaination: There is no evidence the coronavirus was “invented.”
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video says “the coronavirus was invented and patented in the USA and then planted in China.”

Explanation:There is no evidence the coronavirus was “invented.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/10/youtube-videos/coronavirus-was-not-us-invention/

Claim: Two photos showing notes scattered on a street have been shared hundreds of times on Facebook and YouTube alongside a claim they were taken in Italy during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The posts claim Italians have thrown money out of their homes in a symbolic gesture to highlight that money is futile during the pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photos have circulated online since at least March 2019 in reports about two separate incidents in Venezuela.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Two photos showing notes scattered on a street have been shared hundreds of times on Facebook and YouTube alongside a claim they were taken in Italy during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The posts claim Italians have thrown money out of their homes in a symbolic gesture to highlight that money is futile during the pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photos have circulated online since at least March 2019 in reports about two separate incidents in Venezuela.

https://factcheck.afp.com/these-photos-have-circulated-online-least-march-2019-covid-19-pandemic

Claim: Cristiano Ronaldo is turning his hotels into hospitals to fight coronavirus.
Explaination: Ronaldo's management company denied the claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Cristiano Ronaldo is turning his hotels into hospitals to fight coronavirus.

Explanation:Ronaldo's management company denied the claim.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471937-fact-check-cristiano-ronaldo-is-not-turning-his-cr7-hotels-into-hospitals-for-people-with-coronavirus.html

Claim: Indian City Bangalore Municipal Corp. requested people to stay at home and lock down houses as they will be spraying medicine to kill coronavirus.
Explaination: Municipal commissioner of the city has no such plans of spraying medicines to kill COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian City Bangalore Municipal Corp. requested people to stay at home and lock down houses as they will be spraying medicine to kill coronavirus.

Explanation:Municipal commissioner of the city has no such plans of spraying medicines to kill COVID-19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/21/fact-check-bbmp-spraying-medicine-to-kill-coronavirus/?check=1

Claim: 2019 coronavirus can live for “up to 3 hours in the air, up to 4 hours on copper, up to 24 hours on cardboard up to 3 days on plastic and stainless steel.”
Explaination: Preliminary research indicates that COVID-19 can live for up to three hours in the air, four hours on copper, 24 hours on cardboard and three days on plastic and stainless steel.
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: 2019 coronavirus can live for “up to 3 hours in the air, up to 4 hours on copper, up to 24 hours on cardboard up to 3 days on plastic and stainless steel.”

Explanation:Preliminary research indicates that COVID-19 can live for up to three hours in the air, four hours on copper, 24 hours on cardboard and three days on plastic and stainless steel.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/20/facebook-posts/covid-19-could-live-3-days-depending-surface/

Claim: Italian doctors recommend taking off shoes when you get home.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italian doctors recommend taking off shoes when you get home.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?check=21

Claim: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.
Explaination: There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.

Explanation:There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.

https://www.thejournal.ie/debunked-drinking-tea-covid-19-coronavirus-5057320-Mar2020/

Claim: “Donald Trump would receive $17 million for three hotels closed for four days under Republican bill! How in the hell is this right?!”
Explaination: The Senate-approved bill prohibits Trump family hotels from getting coronavirus aid from a $500 billion fund that would be set up to help businesses that incurred losses from the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Donald Trump would receive $17 million for three hotels closed for four days under Republican bill! How in the hell is this right?!”

Explanation:The Senate-approved bill prohibits Trump family hotels from getting coronavirus aid from a $500 billion fund that would be set up to help businesses that incurred losses from the coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/26/facebook-posts/trump-hotels-would-be-barred-getting-coronavirus-m/

Claim: This video shows a woman eating a bat soup in Wuhan.
Explaination: Video shot in Palau in 2016.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This video shows a woman eating a bat soup in Wuhan.

Explanation:Video shot in Palau in 2016.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus?check=3
